instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Lcd Backlight Powers On And works
threads.message: Hello guys i'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> issue it has no backlight. Here is what i found i have 12 v on pins 3 and 4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>, the problem to me is i have no <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> therefor  the chip won't send pin 3 to a lower voltage to open the drain i traced <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> to <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> then i found that pin 63 <SIGNAL>EPD_IG_BKL_ON</SIGNAL> has no power checked at resistor <RESISTOR>R1281</RESISTOR> Pin 1 i'm completely freakinhg confused. What should i check from here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Lcd Backlight Powers On And works
threads.message: So, you have image on the screen but no backlight? Have you tried another LCD assembly??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Lcd Backlight Powers On And works
threads.message: Yes I see image but have not tried another lcd I have one but it's cracked I could try it
